concept.title: Choosing Career Outcomes
concept.shortdesc: Shortly after a student has laid out their technical elective roadmap, they will need to begin making post-graduation plans. This guide is intended to fascilitate those questions, which will largely be directed toward seniors in the ISyE program.

ol.li: Print the student's current Academic Process Audit Summary (APAS) report.
From the APAS report, verify which entry level ISyE required courses have been completed.
Mark off the student's completed courses on the ISyE four-year sample program. This guide will provide students with an easy-to-read planning tool to ensure they graduate on time.
Run through their APAS report and the ISyE four-year sample program to verify the student's graduation plan.
Review any final technical elective changes. A student's interests may have shifted since they were in an internship over the summer, for instance.
Verify that the student has RSVP'd for the graduation ceremony. Information about graduation day is largely sent via email.
Suggest the student shift to the Career Center for further advising. They can also choose to meet with a faculty advisor who has experience in the industry they are pursuing.
Log the meeting notes into APLUS.
If there is any follow-up communication, either schedule or perform it.

row.entry: What events should students be aware of?
The career fairs in September and February can offer post-graduation internship and hiring opportunities.
What kind of activities should students be engaging in to be job ready?

On campus there are regular industry information sessions and off-site interviews, although the timing changes year-to-year. Students should consider having their resume reviewed, learning about negotiation strategies for income and job benefits, and actively searching for networking opportunities.
